p: Traditional knowledge (TK) is the result of the secular experience of these communities living among the local biodiversity, their relationship with the environment, and their use of different species for their benefit [ 1– 4]. The indigenous Guarani-Kaiowá community is located in the Central-West region of Brazil. Although the practice of zootherapy is common among the Guarani-Kaiowá, records of the species used, the purposes of treatments, and the forms of drug preparation are scarce. Some of the secular knowledge related to zootherapy is transmitted to the younger generation by the Maxuypy, the matriarch of the family. In this manner, I, Kellen Natalice Villarva, a biologist, and one of the authors of this study, received part of the knowledge of my ethnicity from my grandmother.
